titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Dutch Homesteads exhibit photograph collection V1974.035
titlestmt.author: Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-04-01 19:36:05 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

physdesc.extent: in one folder and one oversize folder.

did.abstract: These photographs were part of a Brooklyn Historical Society exhibit on Dutch homesteads, circa late 1980s. The collection contains photographs of prominent Dutch homes in Brooklyn, such as the Schenck, Wyckoff, Lefferts, and Van Pelt houses.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library under the object ID prefix V1974.35.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: The collection's digital surrogates should be used in place of the originals whenever possible.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Dutch Homesteads exhibit photograph collection, V1974.035, Box number, Object ID number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Images of Dutch homesteads in Brooklyn are also available in the Dutch in New York lantern slide collection, V1974.024, and the Brooklyn historic houses slide collection, V1974.038.
Other collections of exhibit photography include:
Brooklyn Neighborhoods and How They Grew exhibit photograph collection (V1974.034)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Dutch Homestead exhibit photograph collection contains 12 items which range in date from circa 1879 to 1975. The photographs were part of a Brooklyn Historical Society exhibit on Dutch homesteads, circa late 1980s. The collection contains photographs of prominent Dutch homes in Brooklyn, such as the Schenck, Wyckoff, Lefferts, and Van Pelt houses. The neighborhoods of Canarsie, Bushwick, and Gowanus are documented in the collection. Also included is a cabinet card of Rev. Henry Ward Beecher.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
